issues.description: The problem statement instructs students to call `personRepository.save(..)` with a boolean `force` flag (i.e., `save(person, true)`), but the provided template and reference code only include the standard `save(Person)` method inherited from `JpaRepository`. There is no overload accepting a `boolean force` parameter, so students cannot follow this instruction.
issues.suggested_fix: Remove the reference to a `force` flag in the `save` call. Instruct students to simply call `personRepository.save(person)` (or `personService.save(person)`) as shown in the template, or update the instruction to match the existing `save(Person)` signature.

issues.description: The problem statement instructs students to invoke endpoints at URLs prefixed with `/api` (e.g., `PUT /api/persons/{personId}/parents`), but the controller mappings in both the template and solution use paths like `"persons/{personId}/parents"` without the `/api` prefix. This mismatch will confuse students and cause their MockMVC tests or HTTP calls to target the wrong URL.
issues.suggested_fix: Either update the controllerâ€™s base path to include `/api` (for example by adding `@RequestMapping(path = "/api", ...)` on the class or changing each mapping to `@PutMapping("/api/persons/{personId}/parents")`), or remove the `/api` prefix from all example URLs in the problem statement so that they match the existing mappings.
